direction.raw_text: My friends, I didn't refuse out of malice.  You all know me.  When have I ever refused an accommodation? But why, this time?  Because I think this drug business will destroy us in the years to come. It's not like whiskey or gambling or even women which most people want and is forbidden them by the pezzonovante of the Church and the Government.  But drugs?  No.  Even policemen, who help us in gambling and other things would refuse to help us in drugs.  But...I am willing to do whatever all of you think is necessary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe in drugs.  For years I paid my people extra so they wouldn't do that kind of business...$200 a week.  But it didn't matter.  Somebody comes to them and says, "I have powders, if you put up three, four thousand dollar investment, we can make fifty thousand distributing."  Who can resist such a profit? There's no way to control it, as a business...to keep it respectable. (rapping the table) I don't want it near schools!  I don't want it sold to children. That is an infamita. (thinking) In my city I would try to keep the traffic in the dark people, the colored.  They are the best customers, the least troublesome, and they are animals anyway.  They have no respect for their wives or their families or themselves.  Let them lose their souls with drugs. But something has to be done, we can't have everybody running around doing just what they please, like a bunch of anarchists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then, are we agreed; the traffic in drugs will be permitted, but controlled; and Don Corleone agrees to give it protection in the East.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the whole matter then, we have the peace, and let me pay my respects to Don Corleone, whom we have all known over the years as a man of his word. (noticing TATTAGLIA is uneasy) Don Philip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agree to everything here, I'm willing to forget my own misfortune. But I must hear strict assurance from Corleone.  When time goes by and his position becomes stronger, will he attempt any individual vengeance? They all look at the DON; especially HAGEN, who feels that
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has given a great deal, and must have something else in mind.  Slowly the DON rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forego my vengeance for my dead son, for the common good.  But I have selfish reasons.  My youngest son had to flee, accused of Sollozzo's murder, and I must now make arrangements so that he can come home with safety, cleared of all those false charges.  That is my affair, and I will make those arrangements. (with strength) But I am a superstitious man...and so if some unlucky accident should befall my youngest son, if some police officer should accidentally shoot him, or if he should hang himself in his cell, or if my son is struck by a bolt of lightning, then I will blame some of the people here.  That, I could never forgive, but...aside from that, let me swear by the souls of my Grandchildren that I will never be the one to break the peace we have made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : DON'S LIMO (SPRING 1946) The DON's black limousine.  He sits quietly in the padded rear seat; TOM HAGEN next to him. It is night.  Lights flash by them every so often.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I meet with Tattaglia's people; should I insist that all his drug middle-men be clean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mention it, don't insist.  Barzini is a man who will know that without being told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean Tattaglia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barzini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was the one behind Sollozzo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tattaglia is a pimp.  He could never have outfought Santino.  But I wasn't sure until this day.  No, it was Barzini all along. The black limousine speeds away from us in the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : ESTABLISHING SICILY SHOT A CLOSE VIEW OF MICHAEL, moving as he walks, sullen and downcast, the left side of his face healed, but left grotesque and misshapen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: he wears a warm navy Pea jacket, and walks with his hands in his pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: revealing a Sicilian SHEPHERD on either side of him, each carrying a shotgun slung over his shoulder, CALO, a squat and husky young man with a simple honest quality, and FABRIZZIO, slender and handsome, likable, and with a pleasing build.  Each of the SHEPHERDS  carry knapsacks. The THREE YOUNG MEN continue over the Sicilian landscape, overlooking an impressive view of land and sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : SICILY ROAD The THREE move through a flock of wind-blown sheep, and make their way to a dusty rural road.  We HEAR a rinky horn sound, as a pre-war Italian automobile makes its way to them. An OLD MAN peeks from the window, waving to MICHAEL.  The car pulls in front of them and stops.  MICHAEL nods respectfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don Tommassino.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael, why must you do this.  We have been lucky so far, all these months you've been here we've kept your name a secret.  It is from love for your father that I've asked you never to more than an hour from the Villa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calo and Fabrizzio are with me; nothing will happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must understand that your Father's enemies have friends in Palermo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corleone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is nothing there.  Not anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was told that my Grandfather was murdered on its main street; and his murderers came to kill my father there when he was twelve years old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long ago.  Now there is nothing: the men killed each other in family vendettas...the others escaped to America.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don Tommassino...I should see this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thinks a moment, then concedes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is your birthright...but Michael, use this car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...I would like to walk to Corleone. The OLD MAN sighs, and then returns to his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful Michael, don't let them know your name. The old car sputters off; MICHAEL watches, and then continues on his journey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : COUNTRYSIDE The THREE pass through abundant areas of flowers and fruit trees, in bloom and bursting with life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VILLAGE They continue in the empty streets of a little town; the post-war poverty is evident in the skinny dogs; and the empty streets.  Occasionally, a military vehicle, the only gasoline-powered vehicles on the road, will pass.  And there are many POLICE evident, most of them carrying machine guns. The THREE pass under an enormous banner slung over the main road "VOTA COMMUNISTA".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : COUNTRY ROAD They continue through dusty country roads, where occasionally a donkey pulling a cart, or a lone horseman will pass them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FIELD Out in a field, in the distance, they come upon a procession of peasants and activists, perhaps two hundred strong, marching, and singing, and in the lead, are five or six men carrying billowing red banners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : GROVE They are in an orange grove; on the other side of the trees is a deep, tall field of wild flowers. The Shepherds unsling their guns and knapsacks, and take out loaves of bread, some wine, sausage and cheese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rests against a tree, and uses his handkerchief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell us about America.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know I come from America?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear.  We were told you were a Pezzonovanta...big shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only the son of a Pezzonovanta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey America!  Is she as rich as they say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take me to America!  You need a good lupara in America? (pats his shotgun) You take me, I'll be the best man you got.  "Oh say, can you seeee...By da star early light..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : ANOTHER ROAD The TRIO continues down a dirt road, as an American Military convoy speeds by; FABRIZZIO waves, and calls out to each of the U.S. drivers, as they move by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: America. Hey America! Take me with you! Hey, take me to America G.I.!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CORLEONE HILL They continue their long hike, high on a promentory; until they hesitate, and look down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corleone. They can see a grim Sicilian village, almost devoid of people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CORLEONE STREET MICHAEL and his bodyguards move through the empty streets of the village.  They walk behind him, and spread to either side about fifteen feet away from him. They move down ancient steps, past an old stone fountain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitates, cups his hands and drinks some water. They go on. They move up a very narrow old street.  MICHAEL looks at the doorways that they pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW: Each door has a plaque, with a ribbon or flower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees MICHAEL looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The names of the dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitates in the center of the main street.  He looks. The street is empty, barren.  Occasionally, an old woman will pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns his head. The other side of the street: empty and deathly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of MICHAEL standing in the center of the old street, the shepherds a respectful distance away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : BARONIAL ESTATE A green ribboned field of a baronial Estate.  Further ahead is a villa so Roman it looks as though it had just been discovered in the ruins of Pompeii.  There is a group of young village GIRLS accompanied by two stocky MATRONS, dressed in black.  They have been gathering the pink sulla, purple wisteria, and mixing them with orange and lemon blossoms.  They are singing, off in the distance as they work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and FABRIZZIO are silent as they watch this Fantasy-like scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, beautiful girls!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhhhh. He settles down to watch. The GIRLS are dressed in cheap gaily painted frocks that cling to their bodies.  They are still in their teens, but developed and womanly. They are moving along the fields, picking blossoms, not aware of the three men watching them from the orange grove. Three or four of the girls begin chasing one of them playfully, in the direction of the grove. The GIRL being chased holds a bunch of purple grapes in her left hand and with the right, picks more grapes, and throws them back at her pursuers laughing. They come closer and closer.  Just short of the grove, she poses, startled, her large, oval shaped eyes catching the view of the THREE MEN.  She stands there on her toes about to run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees her; now face to face.  He looks. Her face.  Incredibly beautiful with olive skin, black hair and a rich mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ, take my soul.  I'm dying. Quickly, she turns, and runs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands up never taking his eyes from her.  We hold on him for a long while; and eventually hear the SHEPHERDS laughing.  Then he turns to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got hit by the thunderbolt, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pats him on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't hide it when you're hit by the thunderbolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : BARONIAL VILLAGE The little village built attendant to the Baronial Estate, is decked with the flowers the girls had been picking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: followed by the bodyguards, moves into the central square, and onto the balcony of a little cafe. The proprietor of the cafe, VITELLI, is a short burly man; he greets them cheerfully, and sets a dish of chickpeas at their table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know all the girls in this town, eh?  We saw some beauties coming down the road.  One in particular got our friend hit with the Thunderbolt... (he indicates MICHAEL)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives a big knowing laugh, and looks at MICHAEL with new interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had better bring a few bottles home with you, my friend; you'll need help sleeping tonight. (he laughs)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one could seduce the devil.  A body! and eyes as big and black as olives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know about what you mean!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was a beauty.  Right, Calo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beautiful all over, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And hair.  Black and curly, like a doll.  And such a mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: does not laugh quite so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, we have beautiful girls here... but virtuous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is no longer drinking with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wore a red dress, and a red ribbon in her hair.  She looks more Greek than Italian.  Do you know a beauty like that? As MICHAEL describes her, VITELLI laughed less and less, until he wears a scowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Then he curtly leaves him, and walks into the back room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God in Heaven, I think I understand... He goes into the back room after the innkeeper.  Then he returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get out of here; he's boiling up his blood to do us mischief. It's his daughter. They start to leave; but MICHAEL doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Innkeeper.  More wine!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old bastard mentioned two sons he only has to whistle up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to FABRIZZIO with his cold authority.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him to come to me. The two BODYGUARDS shoulder their luparas, and disappear in a moment they return with the red-faced angry VITELLI between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand I've offended you by talking about your daughter.  I offer you my apologies, I'm a stranger in this country, I don't know the customs very well.  Let me say this, I meant no disrespect to you or her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and FABRIZZIO are impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you and what do you want from my daughter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am an American hiding in Sicily from the police of my country.  My name is Michael.  You can inform the police and make your fortune but then your daughter would lose a father rather than gain a husband. In any case, I want to meet your daughter.  With your permission and under the supervision of your family.  With all decorum.  With all respect.  I am an honorable man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and FABRIZZIO are stupefied; VITELLI pauses, and then asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you a friend of the friends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the proper time comes, I'll tell you everything that a wife's father should know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the real Thunderbolt, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come Sunday morning:  My name is Vitelli and my house is up there on the hill, above the village.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your daughter's name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Appolonia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : TOMMASSINO COURTYARD MUSIC comes up; as MICHAEL, dressed in new clothes from Palermo, and carrying a stack of wrapped gifts, gets into an Alfa Romeo.  CALO and FABRIZZIO each dressed in their Sunday best, are in the rear seat, huddled together, with their luparas on their shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waves them off, as the little car drives off, rocky and bouncing on the dirt road. The Sunday churchbells ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VITELLI HOUSE MICHAEL is presented to each of the Vitelli relatives, by the yard of their little hilltop house; the BROTHERS; the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who is given a gift; several UNCLES and AUNTS. Finally APPOLONIA enters, dressed beautifully in appropriate Sunday clothing.  Now he presents the wrapped gift to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  She looks at her MOTHER, who with a nod gives her permission to open it.  She unwraps it.  Her eyes light at the sight of a heavy gold chain; to be worn as a necklace. She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grazia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VITELLI CAFE Now the little Alpha drives into the village near VITELLI's cafe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is, as ever, accompanied with his two BODYGUARDS, though they are all dressed differently. They go up to the cafe...and sit with VITELLI, who is talking and talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at APPOLONIA; who sits, respectfully quiet. She wears the gold necklace around her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : HILLTOP NEAR VITELLI HOME MICHAEL and APPOLONIA are walking through a hilltop path, seemingly alone, although a respectful distance apart. As the VIEW PANS with them, we notice that her MOTHER and a half dozen AUNTS are twenty paces behind them, and ten paces further behind are CALO and FABRIZZIO, their luparas on their shoulders. Further up the hill, APPOLONIA stumbles on a loose stone, and falls briefly onto MICHAEL's arm.  She modestly regains her balance, and they continue walking. Behind them, her MOTHER giggles to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VITELLI VILLAGE CHURCH Church bells in an ancient belfry ring out.  Music, old and dissonant, plays. There is a bridal procession in the street of the village; the same in feeling and texture as it might have been five hundred years ago. Donkeys and other animals have been decorated with abundant flowers; children carrying candles and wearing white confirmation gowns walk in the procession, followed by countless townspeople, members of the clergy, even the police. We present the entire bridal procession and ceremony with all the ritual and pageantry, as it has always been, in Sicily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is radiant as the Bride; MICHAEL is handsome despite the grotesque jaw and occasional white handkerchief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VITELLI VILLAGE SQUARE CALO and FABRIZZIO dance wildly through the night of the great wedding celebration.  It is held in the Village Square; under the watchful eyes of SHEPHERDS above on the tops of buildings, carrying luparas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MICHAEL'S ROOM IN VILLA MICHAEL opens the shutters in his darkened room; moonlight fills the room. He turns, and there, in her wedding slip, is APPOLONIA.  A little frightened; but lovely. He moves to her; and for a moment just stands before her, looking at her incredible face; her lovely hair and body. Slowly and tenderly he kisses her.  Her tiny hands come up to his face; touch his cheek and embrace him. She lets her bridal slip fall to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MICHAEL'S ROOM AT VILLA Morning.  MICHAEL sits on the window ledge, gazing into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is asleep; she is naked, and only partially covered by the bedsheets. He looks at her for a long time in the early morning light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : TOMMASSINO COURTYARD HIGH ANGLE ON DON TOMMASSINO'S VILLA We HEAR girlish laughter; the little Alpha is driving erratically, knocking down an occasional wall, and almost hitting th inner court wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is laughing, driving.  MICHAEL pretends to be frightened, as he teaches her to drive. Outside the walls, we notice SHEPHERDS with luparas, walking guard duty. The car stops and a laughing MICHAEL gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's safer to teach you English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday...See, I learned it.  Now teach me to drive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters the Courtyard.  He seems tired and concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ciao, Don Tommassino.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things went badly in Palermo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The younger men have no respect. Things are changing; I don't know what will happen.  Michael, because of the wedding, people now know your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that why there are more men on the walls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even so, I don't think it is safe here anymore.  I've made plans to move you to a villa near Siracuse. You must go right away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad news from America.  Your brother, Santino.  He has been killed. For a moment, the whole world of New York, Sollozzo, the Five Family War, all comes back to MICHAEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VILLA COURTYARD Morning.  MICHAEL leans out of the bedroom window. Below, FABRIZZIO is sitting in one of the garden chairs, combing his thick hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: whistles and FABRIZZIO looks up to his window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the car.  I'll be leaving in ten minutes.  Where's Calo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calo is having a cup of coffee in the kitchen.  Is your wife coming with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, she's going home to her family. She'll join me in a few weeks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VILLA KITCHEN MICHAEL, dressed, crosses from the hallway, and into the kitchen.  CALO is just finishing a bite.  He rises when he sees MICHAEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I get your bag?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'll get it.  Where's Appolonia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is sitting in the driver's seat of the car, dying to step on the gas.  She'll be a real American woman before she gets to America.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell Fabrizzio and wait for me in the car. He leaves the kitchen, after a quick sip of coffee. He looks out from the opening in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VILLA COURTYARD There is the car, with APPOLONIA sitting in the driver's seat, playing with the wheel like a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves to the car, and puts a lunch basket in the rear seat. Then MICHAEL seems disturbed. Over, on the other side of the courtyard, he sees FABRIZZIO disappear through the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the hell is he going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes down the hallway, and outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps out into the bright sunlight of the outer courtyard, causing him to shade his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees him, and waves, motioning that he should stay where he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll drive to you. He smiles affectionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands beside the car, smiling, with his lupara dangling by his side.  There is no sight of FABRIZZIO.  Suddenly the smile fades from MICHAEL's face.  He steps forward and holds out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  No! His shout is drowned in the roar of a tremendous EXPLOSION, as she switched on the ignition. Part of the wall is caved in, the kitchen door is blown off; and there is nothing left of the Alpha, or of Appolonia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is thrown against the wall, and knocked unconscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VILLA BEDROOM MICHAEL is unconscious in a darkened room.  We hear whispering around him, but can't make any of it out.  A soft cloth is applied to his face; gradually his eyes open.  DON TOMMASSINO is there, close to him.  He looks at them and from their grave expressions, he knows his wife is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fabrizzio.  Let your shepherds know that the one who gives me Fabrizzio will own the finest pastures in Sicily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALL (SPRING 1951) Easter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the springtime.  Hordes of little CHILDREN including many of the Corleone Children and Grandchilren, rush about carrying little Easter baskets, searching here and there for candy treasures and hidden Easter eggs. The DON himself, much older, much smaller in size, wearing baggy pants and a plaid shirt and an old hat, moves around his garden, tending rows and rows of rich tomato plants. Suddenly, he stops and looks.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A HIGH VIEW ON THE CORLEONE MALL

direction.raw_text: stands there, still holding his suitcase. Great emotion comes over the DON, who takes a few steps in MICHAEL's direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaves his suitcase and walks to his favorite son and embraces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be my son...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE OLIVE OIL FACTORY DON CORLEONE

direction.raw_text: : THE OLIVE OIL FACTORY DON CORLEONE leads MICHAEL through the corridors of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This old building has seen its day. No way to do business...too small, too old. They enter the DON's glass-panelled office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you thought about a wife?  A family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand, Michael.  But you must make a family, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want children, I want a family. But I don't know when.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Accept what's happened, Michael.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could accept everything that's happened; I could accept it, but that I never had a choice.  From the time I was born, you had laid this all out for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I wanted other things for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted me to be your son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but sons who would be professors, scientists, musicians...and grandchildren who could be, who knows, a Governor, a President even, nothing's impossible here in America.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why have I become a man like you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are like me, we refuse to be fools, to be puppets dancing on a string pulled by other men.  I hoped the time for guns and killing and massacres was over.  That was my misfortune.  That was your misfortune.  I was hunted on the streets of Corleone when I was twelve years old because of who my father was.  I had no choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man has to choose what he will be. I believe that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else do you believe in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe in a family.  Can you believe in your country?  Those Pezzonovante of the State who decide what we shall do with our lives?  Who declare wars they wish us to fight in to protect what they own.  Do you put your fate in the hands of men whose only talent is that they tricked a bloc of people to vote for them?  Michael, in five years the Corleone family can be completely legitimate.  Very difficult things have to happen to make that possible.  I can't do them anymore, but you can, if you choose to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe in a family; believe in a Code of Honor, older and higher, believe in Roots that go back thousands of years into your Race. Make a family, Michael, and protect it.  These are our affairs, sono cosa nostra, Governments only protect men who have their own individual power.  Be one of those men...you have the choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : STOCK FOOTAGE LAS VEGAS (1955) A MOVING VIEW, driving up the Las Vegas Strip of 1955.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a new one.  Construction going on everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: showing new hotels and casinos being built; the bill marquees read: "MARTIN AND LEWIS", "PATTI PAGE", etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's one of the family's new ones. Not bad, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FLAMINGO (1955) The car pulls up at the Flamingo Hotel. Inside the car: MICHAEL, FREDO, TOM HAGEN and a new man,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: quiet and sinister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't Moe Green meet us at the airport?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had business at the hotel, but he'll drop in for dinner. From the expression on MICHAEL's face we know this is a discourtesy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FLAMINGO HOTEL SUITE (1955) A whole entourage precedes FREDO and his V.I.P. party of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and NERI.  Great fuss is made.  They are being shown into the hotel's 'special' suite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look wonderful, kid; really wonderful.  That doctor did some job on your face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look good, too. They enter the suite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is as excited as a kid, snapping orders at the bellboys, waiters and maids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kid, take a look-see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives a look to HAGEN, and continues into the bedroom. There is an enormous circular bed on a huge platform, mirrors to each side.  FREDO points upward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into a large CEILING mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever seen anything like that before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FLAMINGO SUITE BEDROOM (1955) MICHAEL is alone in the bedroom.  He is just finishing dressing; he puts on his jacket.  From the window, with the lights blinking, we can tell it's late at night.  MICHAEL passes into the other room. He stops, looks.  He is disturbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FLAMINGO SUITE (1955) A magnificent, circular table has been set up in his suite; a lavish table setting for eight.  Standing by the table are
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looking wonderful, a little heavier, beautifully dressed; FREDO, a dandy, and TWO LAS VEGAS GIRLS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands quietly by the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike!  The party starting!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come here a minute, Fredo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes to him, a big smile all over his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are those girls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for you to find out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give them some money and send them home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get rid of them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FLAMINGO SUITE (1955) They are seated around the lavish table in Michael's suite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is speaking to JOHNNY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny, the Corleone family is thinking of selling out all our interests in the Olive Oil business and settling here.  Moe Greene will sell us his interest so it can be wholly owned by friends of the family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: seems anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, you sure about Moe selling. He never mentioned it to me and he loves the business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll make him an offer he can't refuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to JOHNNY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny, the Don wants you to help us get started.  We figure entertainment will be the big factor in drawing gamblers.  We hope you'll sign a contract to appear five times a year for maybe a week long engagement. We hope your friends in the movies will do the same.  We count on you to convince them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, I'll do anything for my Godfather.  You know that, Mike. There is knock on the door.  NERI rises, looks at MICHAEL, who nods.  NERI opens the door, and MOE GREENE enters, followed by TWO BODYGUARDS.  He is a handsome hood, dressed in the Hollywood style.  His BODYGUARDS are more West Coast style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, good to see you.  Got everything you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chef cooked for you special; the dancers will kick your tongue out and you credit is good! (to his BODYGUARDS) Draw chips for all these people so they can play on the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is my credit good enough to buy you out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buy me out?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hotel, the casino.  The Corleone family wants to buy you out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops laughing; the room becomes tense.  NERI eyes the BODYGUARDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Corleone family wants to buy me out.  I buy you out.  You don't buy me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your casino loses money.  Maybe we can do better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I scam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're unlucky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You goddamn dagos.  I do you a favor and take Freddie in when you're having a bad time, and then you try to push me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You took Freddie in because the Corleone family bankrolled your casino.  You and the Corleone family are evened out.  This is for business; name your price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Corleone family don't have that kind of muscle anymore.  The Godfather is sick.  You're getting chased out of New York by Barzini and the other families, and you think you can find easier pickings here.  I've talked to Barzini; I can make a deal with him and keep my hotel!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that why you thought you could slap Freddie around in public?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah Mike, that was nothing.  Moe didn't mean anything.  He flies off the handle sometimes; but me and him are good friends.  Right, Moe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah sure.  Sometimes I gotta kick asses to make this place run right. Freddie and I had a little argument and I had to straighten him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You straightened my brother out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, he was banging cocktail waitresses two at a time.  Players couldn't get a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rises from his chair, and says in a tone of dismissal:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to go back to New York tomorrow.  Think of your price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son of a bitch, you think you can brush me off like that?  I made my bones when you were going out with cheerleaders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, you're the Consigliere; you can talk to the Don and advise him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Don has semi-retired.  I'm running the Family business now. So anything you have to say, say it to me. Nobody answers.  MICHAEL nods to NERI, who opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: exits angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddie, you're my older brother. I love you.  But don't ever take sides with anybody against the Family again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : N.Y. AIRPORT (1955) KAY sits in the back of a limousine parked by the Newark
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  ROCCO LAMPONE is leaning against it. She has a little three year old boy; MICHAEL's son, who plays with a cardboard bird on a string. Two other cars are stationed discreetly, with men we have learned to tell are bodyguards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and NERI exit the airport with TWO NEGRO PORTERS carrying luggage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees something, and taps MICHAEL on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns, and sees KAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens the car door; KAY steps out with the BOY, and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: embraces her, and kisses his son.  Automatically, the luggage is put in.  NERI replaces LAMPONE as the driver; and LAMPONE joins the other men.  HAGEN gets into one of the other cars. And the limo drives off, preceded and followed by the other sedans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : LIMO (1955) The little BOY looks out the window as they drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to see my father and his people when we get back to the Mall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Michael.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll go to the show tomorrow night--we can change the tickets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you want dinner first?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you eat...don't wait up for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wake me up when you come to bed? The little BOY flies his cardboard bird out of the speeding limousine window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALL (1955) The limousine arrives at the Mall.  We are inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your sister wants to ask you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let HER ask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens the door.  KAY wants to talk just a little more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's afraid to.  Michael...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods to NERI; who gives them their privacy a moment longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you so cold to her and Carlo?  They live with us on the Mall now, but you never get close to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm busy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Connie and Carlo want you to be godfather to their little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens the door; MICHAEL starts to get out; KAY too. He smiles at her, tired, and a little sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me think about it, O.K.? She smiles; MICHAEL goes with NERI to the Main House; KAY and the little BOY move to the house that was Sonny's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : DON'S OFFICE (1955) VIEW ON DON CORLEONE, much older, much smaller in size.  He wears baggy pants, and a warm plaid shirt.  He sits in a chair, gazing out through the window, into the garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barzini's people chisel my territory and we do nothing about it.  Pretty soon there won't be one place in Brooklyn I can hang my hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just be patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not asking you for help, Mike. Just take off the handcuffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta fight sometime.  Let us at least recruit our regimes to full strength.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't want to give Barzini an excuse to start fighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, you're wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don Corleone...Don Corleone. The OLD MAN looks up.  CLEMENZA stand before him in the Den. Beside him is an anxious TESSIO.  NERI stands by the door;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is seated; MICHAEL sits behind the big desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said there would come a day when Tessio and me could form our own Families.  Only with your benediction, of course.  I ask permission...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My son is head of the Family now. If you have his permission, you have my good will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In six months you can break off from the Corleone Family and go on your own.  Carlo, I'm counting on you to make the move to Nevada; you'll be my right-hand man out there.  Tom Hagen is no longer the Consigliere. Everyone is a bit surprised; look to see HAGEN's reaction. He remains inexpressive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to be our lawyer in Vegas.  Nobody goes to him with any other business as of now, this minute.  No reflection on Tom; that's the way I want it.  Besides, if I ever need any advice, who's a better Consigliere than my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then in a six month time we're on our own; is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe less...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let us fill up our Regimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I want things very calm for another six months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, Godfather, let our years of friendship be my excuse. How can you hope for success there without your strength here to back you up?  The two  go hand in hand. And with you gone from here the Barzini and the Tattaglias will be too strong for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I don't like Barzini.  I say the Corleone Family has to move from strength, not weakness.  We should build our Regimes and take back our lost territories in Staten Island, at least.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have faith in my judgement?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Godfather...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then do what Michael says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I can say is that things are being resolved that are more effective than a thousand buttonmen on the streets.  Understood? There are uneasy looks all around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Understood.  I just wish I was doing more to help out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll come to you when I need you. He looks at CLEMENZA, TESSIO and HAGEN.  They all nod, reluctantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, then it's resolved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knows the meeting is over, he opens the Den's door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and TESSIO pay their respects to the DON and leave, then CARLO.  NERI watches CARLO as he walks down the corridor, casting a nervous look back at the sinister man. Then NERI closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: relaxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, why are you cutting me out of the action?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, we're going to be legitimate all the way, and you're the legal man.  What could be more important than that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not talking about that.  I'm talking about Rocco Lampone building a secret regime.  Why does Neri report directly to you, rather than through me or a caporegime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you that it wouldn't escape his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you find out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bookkeepers know everything. Rocco's men are all a little too good for the jobs they're supposed to be doing.  They get a little more money than the job's worth. (pause) Lampone's a good man; he's operating perfectly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so perfectly if you noticed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, why am I out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not a wartime Consigliere. Things may get tough with the move we're trying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but then I agree with Tessio. You're going about it all wrong; you're making the move out of weakness... Barzini's a wolf, and if he tears you apart, the other families won't come running to help the Corleones...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, I never thought you were a bad Consigliere, I thought Santino a bad Don, rest in peace.  He had a good heart but he wasn't the right man to head the family when I had my misfortune.  Michael has all my confidence, as you do.  For reasons which you can't know, you must have no part in what will happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I can help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're out, Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pauses, thinks...and then he nods in acquiescence.  TOM leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at NERI.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to talk to my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods, and then leaves.  The DON opens the doors, breathes in the air, and steps outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE GARDEN (1955) DON CORLEONE I see you have your Luca Brasi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll need him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are men in this world who demand to be killed.  They argue in gambling games; they jump out of their cars in a rage if someone so much as scratches their fender. These people wander through the streets calling out "Kill me, kill me."  Luca Brasi was like that. And since he wasn't scared of death, and in fact, looked for it...I made him my weapon.  Because I was the only person in the world that he truly hoped would not kill him.  I think you have done the same with this man. They walk through the DON's vegetable garden.  Tomatoes, peppers, carefully tended, and covered with a silky netting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: follows; the DON turns and looks at him.  Then stoops over to right a tomato plant that had been pushed over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barzini will move against you first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He will get in touch with you through someone you absolutely trust.  That person will arrange a meeting, guarantee your safety... He rises, and looks at Michael...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and at that meeting you will be assassinated. The DON walks on further.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your wife and children...you're happy with them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wants to express something...hesitates, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've always respected you... A long silence.  The DON smiles at MICHAEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I...you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CHURCH (1955) KAY and MAMA walking from the black car that has just left them off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is your husband feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not the same since they shot him.  He lets Michael do all the work.  He just plays the fool with his garden, his peppers, his tomatoes, as if he was some peasant still.  But men are like that... She stops toward the Church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You come in, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Priest ain't gonna bite you cause you're not Catholic. (whispered) He's in the back drinkin' his wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laughs and follows MAMA up the steps of the Church. They enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CHURCH (1955) Inside the Church, KAY watches as MAMA blesses herself from the holy water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can. Tentatively, KAY dips her fingers into the water, and blesses herself.  Then SHE follows MAMA down the aisle, in awe at the high ceiling, the art, the windows, and finally the Altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops by the impressive tiers of candles.  There is a large coin box for those who wish to pay for lighting candles.  MAMA fumbles in her purse for change; KAY gives her some.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops the coins in the box, one by one; then takes the taper, and in a pattern known only to her, and with great dignity, she closes her eyes, says a prayer, and then lights twenty candles. She finishes, and bows her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : BONASERA'S FUNERAL HOME Very few people in the streets.  TOTAL SILENCE.  But black flower cars as far as the eye can see, for blocks and blocks. An expression of respect, of honor and fear that is enormous. Certainly no more could be done for a President or a King. Each car carries an elaborate floral decoration.  We show these in detail; and the flowered messages: "A Benefactor to Mankind", "He Knew and Pitied"..."Our Don Our Leader"..."The Sacred Heart"...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALL (1955) HIGH ANGLE ON THE CORLEONE MALL Silence. The flower cars, funeral limousines, and private cars fill all the areas attendant to the Corleone residence. Hundreds of people fill the Mall, reminiscent in size of the wedding of Connie and Carlo; of course, now the mood is somber and respectful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and HAGEN stand by the flowered platform which holds the ornate coffin.  We cannot see the remains of Don Corleone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is nearby, ready to do service to the bereaved family.  One by one the mourners come by, weeping, or merely with grave expressions; pay their respects and continue on. The VIEW ALTERS, and we see that the line is endless.  JOHNNY FONTANE, tears openly falling, takes his turn. Children are taken by the hand, and lifted for their last look at the great man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: whispers into the ear of LAMPONE.  LAMPONE immediately arranges for the members of the Five New York Families to pay their respects. First CUNEO, then STRACHI and then ZALUCHI.  Then PHILIP TATTAGLIA, who merely passes by the Coffin. Then BARZINI in a black homburg, standing a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: crosses himself and passes on, immediately rejoined by his men. As BARZINI leaves, it seems as though everyone is fawning on him; perhaps asking for favors: But at any rate, it is clear from the doors opened for him, the cigars lit for him, that he is the new Capo di Capi--the place formerly held by Don Corleone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is searching for somebody with his eyes.  First
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Then TESSIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rushes into MICHAEL's arms, tears in her eyes.  He embraces and comforts her. Everywhere MICHAEL goes, NERI is a few feet away--watching all who come close to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALL (LATER) Later on the Mall; some people have left, although there are still hundreds of mourners. A young GIRL approaches TESSIO.  She's about 18.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We danced together at Connie's wedding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes a gesture, which is to say 'How you've grown', and they move though the crowd, looking for Michael.  He finds him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, could I have a minute?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; nods; and they move to a private place.  NERI is close by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barzini wants to arrange a meeting. Says we can straighten any of our problems out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He talked to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can arrange security.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CEMETERY (1955) The Cemetery.  Late day. The hundreds of cars, limousines and flower cars line the stone wall that surrounds this Italian-Catholic cemetary in Queens Village. Hundreds of people stand in a cluster; others watch; take pictures, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands with his family, his MOTHER...and TOM HAGEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, Tom; I needed more time with him.  I really needed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he give you his politicians?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not all...I needed another four months and I would have had them all. (he looks at TOM) I guess you've figured it all out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How will they come at you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know now. (a passion wells up inside of MICHAEL) I'll make them call me Don.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you agreed on a meeting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A week from tonight.  In Brooklyn on Tessio's ground, where I'll be safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him; understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But after the Baptism.  I've decided to stand as godfather to Connie's baby. They look up. The coffin is lowered into an excavation, behind which stands an enormous stone monument; it is of a weeping angel, with the bold inscription: CORLEONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : NERI'S APT. (1955)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves around in his small Corona Apartment; he pulls a small trunk from under his bed.  He opens it, and we see in it, nearly folded, a New York City Policeman's uniform.  He takes it out piece by piece, almost reverently. Then the badge, and the identification card; with his picture on it.  Slowly, in the solitude of his room, he begins to dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MICHAEL'S BEDROOM (1955) MICHAEL and KAY are getting dressed for the christening in their room.  MICHAEL looks very well; very calm; KAY is beginning to take on a matronly look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MOTEL ROOM (1955) In a Long Island motel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: carefully disassembles a revolver; oils it, checks it, and puts it back together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CLEMENZA'S HOUSE (1955) PETER CLEMENZA about to get in his Lincoln.  He hesitates, takes a rag and cleans some dirt off of the fender, and then gets in, drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CHURCH (1955) The Church. Various relatives and friends are beginning to gather at the Church.  They laugh and talk.  A MONSIGNOR is officiating. Not all of the participants have arrived yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is there, with a beaming CARLO.  She holds the infant; showing him off to interested people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : U.N. PLAZA (1955) NERI walks down the sidewalk in the neighborhood of the UN Building.  He is dressed as, and has the bearing of, a policeman.  He carries a huge flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MOTEL BALCONY (1955) LAMPONE steps out onto the little balcony of a Sea-Resort Motel; We can see the bright, neon lit sign advertising
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CHURCH The Church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds the baby; the MONSIGNOR is speaking; KAY and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stand side by side around the urn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you pledge to guide and protect this child if he is left fatherless? Do you promise to shield him against the wickedness of the world?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FIFTH AVE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: continues up the 55th St. and Fifth Avenue area.  He continues until he is in front of Rockefeller Center.  On his side of the street, he spots a limousine waiting directly across from the main entrance of the building.  Slowly he approaches the limo, and taps on its fender with his nightstick. The DRIVER looks up in surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: points to the "No Parking" sign. The DRIVER turns his head away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wise guy, you wanna summons, or you wanna move?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better check with your precinct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move it! The DRIVER takes a ten dollar bill, folds it deliberately, and hands it out the window, trying to put it under NERI's jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: backs up, letting the bill fall onto the street.  Then he crooks a finger at the DRIVER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me see you license and registration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MOTEL BALCONY LAMPONE on the motel balcony spots a Cadillac pulling up. It parks.  A young, pretty GIRL gets out.  Quickly, he returns into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : HOTEL STAIRS (1955) CLEMENZA is climbing the back stairs of a large hotel.  He rounds the corner, puffs a little, and then continues upward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CHURCH The Church.  Close on the PRIEST's fingers as he gently applies oil to the infant's ears and nostrils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ephetha...be opened...So you may perceive the fragrance of God's sweetness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : ROCKEFELLER CENTER (1955) The DRIVER of the limousine in front of Rockefeller Center is arguing with NERI. Now the DRIVER looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in topcoats exit the building, through the revolving glass doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens up fire, trapping BARZINI in the shattering glass doors.  The doors still rotate, moving the dead body of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: within them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CHURCH In the Church--the VIEW on MICHAEL.  The PRIEST hands him the infant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you renounce Satan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do renounce him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And all his works?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do renounce them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MOTEL MURDER (1955) LAMPONE, backed up by two other MEN in his regime, runs down the iron-rail steps, and kicks in the door on Room 7F.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: old and wizened and naked, leaps up; a semi-nude young GIRL leans up. They are riddled with gunfire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : HOTEL STAIRS (1955) CLEMENZA, huffing and puffing, climbs the back stairs, with his package.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CHURCH The PRIEST pours water over the forehead of the infant
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you wish to be baptized?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do wish to be baptized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : HOTEL ELEVATOR MURDER (1955) CLEMENZA, out of breath, climbs the final few steps. He walks through some glass doors, and moves to an ornate elevator waiting shaft. The lights indicate the elevator has arrived. The doors open, and we see a surprised CUNEO standing with the dapper MOE GREENE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fires into the small elevator with a shotgun. The PRIEST hands a lighted candle to MICHAEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I christen you Michael Francis Rizzi. Flash bulbs go off.  Everyone is smiles, and crowds around
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and CARLO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CHURCH (1955) The christening party outside the Church. Four or five limousines have been waiting; now pull up to receive MAMA, CONNIE and the baby; and the others. Everyone is very happy; only MICHAEL seems aloof and grave. As the fuss is going on, a car pulls up.  LAMPONE gets out and works his way to MICHAEL.  He whispers in his ear.  This is the news MICHAEL has been waiting for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds the baby up to MICHAEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiss your Godfather. The infant turns its head, and MICHAEL uses that as an excuse to back away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlo...we've had a change in the plans.  Mama, Connie, Kay and the kids will have to take the trip out to Vegas without us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Mike, it's our first vacation together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, Connie...Sure, Mike...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go back to your house and wait for me... He kisses KAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just be a couple of days... People are guided to the correct limousines; they start to drive off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : DON'S KITCHEN TESSIO sits in the Kitchen of the Main House on the Mall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd better make your call to Barzini; Michael's ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods; moves to the telephone and dials a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're on our way to Brooklyn. He hangs up and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope Mike can get us a good deal tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure he will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALL (1955) The TWO MEN walk out onto the Mall, toward a car.  On their way they are stopped by TWO BODYGUARDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boss says he'll come in a separate car.  He says for you two to go on ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, he can't do that.  It screws up all my arrangements.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appear around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't go with you either, Tessio. He flashes at the men surrounding him; for a moment he panics, and then he accepts it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell Mike it was business...I always liked him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He understands that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at the men, and then pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, can you get me off the hook? For old times' sake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns, and walks away from the group.  Then about twenty paces away, he stops, and looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is led into a waiting car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks away, and walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CARLO'S LIVING ROOM (1955) CARLO RIZZI is alone in his house, smoking, waiting rather nervously.  He moves to the window and looks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALL (1955) MICHAEL, still dressed in a dark suit; followed by NERI, LAMPONE and CLEMENZA, then HAGEN. They move toward us. Excitedly, CARLO moves to the front door; opens it. He wears a broad smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Godfather!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to answer for Santino. The smile on CARLO's face slowly fades, then, in a foolish attempt for safety, he slams the door in their faces and backs into the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CARLO'S LIVING ROOM (1955) The door opens, and the grim party enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fingered Sonny for the Barzini people.  That little farce you played out with my sister.  Did Barzini kid you that would fool a Corleone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear I'm innocent.  I swear on the head of my children, I'm innocent.  Mike, don't do this to me, please Mike, don't do this to me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barzini is dead.  So is Philip Tattaglia, so are Strachi, Cuneo and Moe Greene...I want to square all the family accounts tonight. So don't tell me you're innocent; admit what you did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is silent; he wants to talk but is terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be frightened.  Do you think I'd make my sister a widow?  Do you think I'd make your children fatherless?  After all, I'm Godfather to your son.  No, your punishment is that you're out of the family business.  I'm putting you on a plane to Vegas--and I want you to stay there.  I'll send Connie an allowance, that's all. But don't keep saying you're innocent; it insults my intelligence and makes me angry.  Who approached you, Tattaglia or Barzini?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barzini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, good.  Leave now; there's a car waiting to take you to the airport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves to the door; opens it.  There is a car waiting; with a group of MEN around it. He looks back at MICHAEL, who reassures him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call your wife and tell her what flight you're on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALL CARLO moves out to the Mall; the BUTTONMEN are putting his things in the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens the front door for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is sitting in the rear seat, though we cannot see who.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets into the car; out of nervousness, he looks back to see the other man. It is CLEMENZA, who nods cordially. The motor starts, and as the car pulls away, CLEMENZA suddenly throws the garrote around CARLO's neck.  He chokes and leaps up like a fish on a line, kicking his feet. The garrote is pulled tighter; CARLO's face turns color. His thrashing feet kick right through the front windshield. Then the body goes slack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes a foul face, and opens the window as the car drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CARLO'S STEPS (1955) MICHAEL and his party.  They watch. Then he turns and walks off, and they follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MICHAEL'S LIMO EN ROUTE (1955) MICHAEL sits alone in the back of his car; NERI is driving. They do not speak for a long time; it is night--car lights flash by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I would never question anything you say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speak your mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do this for you; you know I should.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  This I have to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : PIZZA STREET (1955) MICHAEL's car pulls up in a quiet neighborhood, near an Italian Pizzeria.  NERI opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : PIZZA PLACE (1955) He walks alone into the restaurant.  A MAN is tossing pizza dough in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the boss?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the back.  Hey Frank, someone wants you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes out of the shadows, with a strong Italian accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? He stops, frozen in fear.  It is FABRIZZIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Gunfire from under his coat.  FABRIZZIO is cut down.  MICHAEL throws the gun down; turns and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALL (1955) HIGH ANGLE ON THE CORLEONE MALL Several moving vans are parked in the Mall; one feels that these are the final days; the families are moving out; signs indicating that the property is for sale are evident. A black limousine pulls up, and before it has even stopped, the rear door flies open, and CONNIE attempts to run out, restrained by MAMA.  She manages to break free and runs across the Mall into Michael's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : DON'S KITCHEN (1955) She moves back into the kitchen and begins to prepare the drinks.  From her vantage point, as she smilingly makes the drinks, she sees CLEMENZA, NERI and ROCCO LAMPONE enter the house with their BODYGUARDS. She watches with curiosity, as MICHAEL stands to receive them.  He stands arrogantly at ease, weight resting on one foot slightly behind the other.  One hand on his hip, like a Roman Emperor.
